summary:
In summary my key experiences are:
- Process Operations
- Process Control
- Leadership
- Calamity handling
- Operations Management
- Problem Solving
- Task-oriented
- Goal oriented
- Assertive
- Pro-active
- Team player
- Thinking in solutions
- Creative
- Innovative

Leadership Behaviors: According to leadership behaviors I could say that I inspire people with my integrity, positivism and passion. In my formal function as Team Lead I had to delegate work to the operators in my team. This was going very well most of the time and people were always at my service. I think it was because of my honesty and sincerity that people ‘really’ wanted to work for me. When there were problems I always helped people out to provide solutions (or the way to it). If the workload of the operators was too high I managed to divide it over other operators, even if it was not there job. Thereby I was also helping when there were trouble during the production process, by doing so it gave me a lot of respect and  commitment from my team. Because of creating a strong and collaborative team we could handle a lot of pressure by operating as a team.

To achieve this state of collaborations it took a lot of effort to align everyone in my team. This was also caused by the information that the operators received. When employees are not fully informed they make up their own story what ends up in gossip. By informing my team fully they had a better picture by what was ongoing and what they could expect. I experienced that one of the most important things of leadership is clarity.

I believe that when a team works as a unit, goals are achieved naturally, of course there is need of guidance and direction. When every operator has a lot of pleasure in their jobs they work harder, effective and more efficient, and there behavior is more open to ask questions. People are prepared to think larger in the sake of the company.

education.field_of_study: Master of Science (MSc) in Implementation and Change Management

certifications.name: Pearson EDI Level 3 Award in Assessing Competence (POH3)

authors.headline: Project Engineer WTB bij De Voogt Naval Architects

courses.name: Front Line Barier Management Assessor Training

profile_positions.title: Location Responsible Person
Operations Maintenance Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Roles and responsibilities as Turnaround Coordinator (2017 – 2020):
	Coordinate work preparer/planners/schedulers during the planning/preparation phase and works closely with Work Preparators, Maintenance Execution, Contractors, Operations, Project and Discipline Engineering during preparation & execution;
	Prepare the Project Risk Assessment (PRA) sessions, organize and facilitate the Schedule Optimisation sessions.

For 3 years I was responsible for coordinating front-end and execution of turnarounds at NAM Den Helder and ensuring all relevant disciplines were engaged. These were Turnarounds with a medium complexity with large project scope. In 2018 we added a second stage to a reciprocating compressor and in 2019 a flare stack 40m height.  I managed T/As by following and embedding the AMS PTA (Perform Turnarounds) process and deploying a strong and agile organization. At the 3 plants, on average a T/A  contains 2MEur Mtce Scope, with 150-200 persons on site executing the work.
profile_positions.title: Turnaround Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Roles and responsibilities as Production Teamlead (2014 – 2017):
	Accountable for achieving the Safety/Integrity, Production and Availability targets for the installations with a team of 4;
	Accountable for control of work on the plant. Ensure that all conditions are met, using isolation plans, to safely execute activities via risks assessment and appropriate mitigations using quality PtW’s and Operational supervision.
	Supporting the improvement of Production Reliability and Availability and optimisation of Maintenance working with the Productions Specialist and Reliability/Maintenance Engineer.

As PTL I was also focal point for Operational Excellence Blade 24; Operating Integrity (ESP) and managed to embed this in Operations by hosting the monthly OI- meetings to fill out the gaps. This was a great success and is still used and updated by my successor. Another thing what I really liked to do was optimizing work processes. In this role I made a PI- dashboard and the nomination sheet (gas supply and demand) in Excel with VB-code to create alignment and conformity between shifts.
profile_positions.title: Production Team Lead

profile_positions.description: To gain more knowledge over the maintenance process I applied for an internship by work preparation. In this internship I made Work Orders in SAP. This from the begin of the cycle – the Z1 (work request) notification to the Work Order within requesting Purchase Orders. In this months I learned a lot over the whole maintenance process. This includes delivery and buyers work as well, where I discovered the financial process behind work preparation.
profile_positions.title: Work Preparator (Internship)

profile_positions.description: In my role as Assistant Activity Coordinator I am responsible to provide all the people that are performing activities at location NAM Den Helder a safe workplace. To achieve this we work in a group of 5 persons to realize safe conditions. This means that we take care of safeguarding the installation.  A part of the job is isolate and reinstate equipment with several disciplines as electrical, mechanical, civil, scaffolding, insulators, etc. The key competence for this job is to validate, issue and release permits.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Activity Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
As Assistant Operations Supervisor I am responsible for delivering the contracted quantities of gas for the plant Den Helder, in cooperation with the central dispatching center in Assen. Thereby it is very important to monitor the process of offshore production installations.

Another responsibility is that I am focal point during the first phase of a Disaster on the plant Den Helder and Offshore until the emergency team is operational.

In case of absence of the Operations Supervisor I am responsible to manage a team with 4 Operator Senior Technicians. This also contains the responsibility for the safe starting up, shutting down, taking the installations including the making, reviewing and approving the required safety plans for this.

There is an administrative role as Assistant Operations Supervisor as well, this contains:
- Acts as the Operations Representative in new construction and modification projects.
- Directly responsible for the safe running of all activities at the plant and substantively responsible for the operational activities including the handling of condensate, production and waste products.
- Responsible for all relevant Administration of Production and other operational activities.
- Report risks and incidents directly and take appropriate measures to avoid escalation.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Operations Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
During my position of Senior Operations Technician I applied for an internship as Operations Support Engineer. In this role I was partly responsible for the Total Turn Around (the installations is shut down for maintenance) of the HiCal installation. Thereby I was substitute for the Turn Around Coordinator for a few days during the Total Turn Around. I was also responsible for the Kick-Off meeting where I presented the safety instructions and Turn Around scope for all the involved people (150+). 

Another part of this internship was to supply information for the Minor Modification Team and assist them with providing information.  I was also involved by several HAZOP and Safety Case studies. In this short period of internship I learned a lot!
profile_positions.title: Operations Support Engineer (Internship)

profile_positions.description:
My role as Operation Technician is to operate the Gas Treatment plant at Den Helder in a Safe and environmental friendly way. The total capacity of the Gas Treatment plant is 91MNm3/day. 

In my daily duty I'm responsible for operating the gas facility at NAM Den Helder in a team of 6 persons. There are several positions in this team. The roles that I fulfill are operating in the field, this contains; start-up, monitor, operate, isolate and reinstate parts of the plant. An other role is operate the whole treatment facility from the Central Control Room (CCK) by using DCS systems. Hereby I have a lot of interaction with several disciplines as; maintenance, quality and instrumentation, planning, reliability, etc. 

The third role is dispatching, in this job I'm responsible for the amount of gas that's produced offshore. In this function there is a interaction with Dutch Dispatching Center, GasUnie and the production platforms offshore. The most important is to deliver the right amount of gas on specification, and to keep the output nomination the same as the input.
profile_positions.title: Senior Operations Technician

profile_positions.description:
As Team Lead I was supervisor of a group of eight operators and responsible for the production of the Cokes Furnace Gas Purifying Plant and had to ensure to produce it on a safe and environmentally friendly way. 

During this job I (directly) experienced two calamities where people were involved. The first accident concerned two operators that ended up in a cloud of steam and suffered second degree burning wounds. In this situation I was coordinating and guiding the victims (with my team), within 10 minutes the situation was under control and we had all the necessary emergency that was required (2 ambulances, Safety personal, Security, Line manager, BHV) on site.

The second incident was with an operator in my team that suffered from acid in his eyes and mouth. In this situation I reacted quick and acted on his report. I asked a BHV’er to join me and we walked to the injured operator to make him comfortable. Meanwhile the BHV’er was talking to him a called for an ambulance and security (standard procedure) to secure the situation.

Before I applied for a job as Team Lead I prepared and executed large shutdowns. In these shutdowns I experienced a lot of things. Everything was ongoing by the plans, but sometimes I had to improvise. This improvising was very important for progress of the shutdowns and took responsibility to make decisions.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
As operator in the Gas Purifying Installation of Coke Furnace plant 1 I was responsible for operating the process in a safe and environmental friendly way. There were several kinds of processes; chemical and physical. The gas was coming from the accession pipes where gas was cooled from 800grC till 80grC. From there it was transported through a main line to the first cooling till 25grC (indirect). After the first cooling the gas was led through an Electrical Filter (25.000V) to undo the gas of tar, and then the gas was compressed to a pressure of 180mbar. The total gasflow was approximately 60.000m3/h.

When the gas had passed the compressor it was going to the ammonia filters to undo the gas of NH3. Then the gas was going to the after gas coolers with two stage (direct) with naphtha washing between. After that the gas was directed through a BTX and H2S washer. 

There were several byproducts as well, to know; ammonia sulfate, tar, BTX, H2SO4.
profile_positions.title: Process Operator

profile_positions.description:
In my role as operator in Oxygen Steel Factory 2 I had several tasks by the division RST, here the liquid iron was arriving for treatment. The tasks that I perform ware delivering the right iron input for the converter section and operating the treatment installation by calculating the amount of injected Mg and CaC for desulfurization. 

Besides operating processes I was a Crane Operator as well, the meaning of this task was to supply the converter of liquid iron (load up to 420 tons) and scrap (up to 80 tons). Thereby I was also employable for the scrap hall where big containers ware filled with scrap.
profile_positions.title: Process Operator

volunteer_experiences.description:
As volunteer I for fill my role as event coordinator of the Open Water Swimming ‘Oude Veer’. In this position I take care of the license with the local government and make sure that the requirements are performed. Thereby I am the chairman and arrange meetings. 

Around the 400 people are visiting the The Open Water Swimming in the Ouwe Veer. Therefore it is very important to have a smoothly ongoing organisation. Besides the formal documentation it necessary to align the volunteers as well as the third parties that make the event available.

The event is dependent of several other associations; we have to align this third parties to make the event a success. This is an activity for me as well. 

We log everything what we do before and during the event for new volunteers  to control the quality of the event.  I am keeper of the loggings and review them on regularly base. Our goal is to sustain the quality of the event and improve where it is necessary. As commission we always ask our volunteers for improvement and  try to involve them.
After a period as Event Coordinator I decided to be a volunteer to spent less time for this association. In this role as volunteer I support with the equipment build-up and a part of the PR.

My role as volunteer for the gymnastics association is divided in several parts. Mainly I help with the equipment build-up every Saturday for the Elder and Child gym. A few times in a year with the gymnastics competition all the equipment must be moved from the main location to a other 'bigger' location. Then I help with the logistics and positioning the equipment.
